title: Trustworthy and Ethical Assurance Platform
description: Project Lead for the TEA Platform—an online, community-centred platform for enhancing skills and capabilities in AI assurance.

title: TEA Techniques
description: A platform that bridges abstract ethical AI principles with practical implementation, organising techniques by assurance goals such as fairness, explainability, and privacy, and providing a knowledge graph for AI-powered discovery.

title: Digital Twin Network+ (DTNet+)
description: Lead of the Uncertainty and Trust Special Interest Group (SIG) for the UKRI Digital Twin Network+, and member of the DT Policy Working Group.

title: Networks of Cardiovascular Digital Twins (CVD-Net)
description: Co-Lead for work package 6 (Engagement, Assurance, and Ethics) of the EPSRC-funded CVD-Net project, building connected digital twins of patients’ hearts.

title: Turing Commons
description: Co-founder and co-lead of the online skills and training platform for responsible data-driven technology practices.

title: Trustworthy and Ethical Assurance of Digital Twins (TEA-DT)
description: Principal Investigator for the UKRI BRAID-funded project, developing and validating the open-source TEA Platform for trustworthy and ethical digital twin development.

title: Turing Research and Innovation Cluster in Digital Twins (TRIC-DT)
description: Leading of the Innovation and Impact Hub, coordinating the scientific aims across natural environment, health, and infrastructure themes, and managing an interdisciplinary team of research infrastructure roles.
role: Head of Innovation and Impact Hub

title: Trustworthy and Ethical Assurance of Digital Healthcare
description: PI for a collaborative project between the Assuring Autonomy International Programme (University of York) and the Alan Turing Institute, harmonising ethical assurance research with a focus on fairness in digital healthcare.

title: Human Rights, Democracy, and the Rule of Law Assurance Framework (HUDERAF)
description: Developed an end-to-end assurance framework for AI lifecycles, submitted to the Council of Europe, integrating risk analysis, stakeholder engagement, impact assessment, and transparent management.

title: Trustworthy Assurance of Digital Mental Healthcare
description: Principal Investigator for UKRI TAS Hub-funded project developing a method for assuring ethical goals in digital mental healthcare technologies.

title: Co-Developing a Data Charter (Camden Council)
description: Collaborated with Camden Council and Involve on resident panels to develop a data charter ensuring citizen data is used for the common good.
